project_abstract.cdata: The Cereal Seeds Project, designed to establish a modern seeds industry in Bangladesh and to produce 12,000 tons of seeds of high-yielding rice and wheat varieties annually, will include: (a) on-farm development for about 5,000 acres on 17 farms owned by the Bangladesh Agricultural Development Corporation (BADC); (b) establishment of a private seed growers scheme involving about 5,000 acres of land in five districts; (c) installation and operation of seed processing equipment at six locations; (d) improvementof seed storage and marketing; (e) establishment of a seed certification service; (f) development of four Bangladesh Rice Research Institute (BRRI) substations and construction of staff housing; and (g) related training program and technical assistance.
